events.message: Customer reported a car collision on April 28th involving rear-end damage and filed a claim promptly for evaluation.
The claim was categorised under Auto Accident due to keywords identified in the initial report and damage description.
An insurance agent was assigned to manage the claim and establish initial contact with the claimant.
The claimant received an official acknowledgment confirming the insurance company is processing the accident claim.
Requested official accident report, vehicle repair estimates, and photographs of the collision damage for claim assessment.
Customer submitted all requested documents including police report and repair quotes within the expected timeframe.
The investigation team began reviewing submitted evidence and contacted witnesses to verify collision circumstances.
Investigation concluded confirming the claimant was not at fault and all documentation validated for damage claim.
A settlement offer was proposed covering the estimated repair costs and rental vehicle expenses during repair.
The customer responded positively to the settlement offer, appreciating the prompt resolution of their auto accident claim.
The claim was officially approved by the claims department following acceptance of the proposed settlement by the customer.
Payment was issued to the claimantâ€™s account to cover the agreed settlement amount for their vehicle repair.
The claim was formally closed after successful payment transfer and confirmation of repair completion.
All files related to the auto accident claim were archived in the system for future reference and compliance purposes.
